name: Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE)
description: CVE International in scope and free for public use, CVE is a dictionary of publicly known information security vulnerabilities and exposures. CVE's common identifiers enable data exchange between security products and provide a baseline index point for evaluating coverage of tools and services.

name: Metasploit
description: Table of metasploit modules info

name: Exploit DB
description: 'An ultimate archive of exploits and vulnerable software.'  Includes downloadable archive, and RSS feed.

name: National Vulnerability Database
description: NVD is the U.S. government repository of standards based vulnerability management data represented using the Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP). This data enables automation of vulnerability management, security measurement, and compliance. NVD includes databases of security checklists, security related software flaws, misconfigurations, product names, and impact metrics.

name: World Laboratory of Bugtraq 2
description: World Laboratory of Bugtraq 2 is a huge collection of information on data communications safety. Its main objective is to inform about errors in various applications.

name: Open Source Vulnerability Database
description: OSVDB's goal is to provide accurate, detailed, current, and unbiased technical security information. Website has a twitter feed, news feed, top viewed vulnerabilites feed, top blogged vulnerabilities feed.

name: CVE Details
description: Easy to use web interface to CVE vulnerability data. You can browse for vendors, products and versions and view cve entries, vulnerabilities, related to them. You can view statistics about vendors, products and versions of products. CVE details are displayed in a single, easy to use page, see a sample nicely outlines CVSS score and components of it (I think CVSS seems useless) products affected, by type (for example, application), vendor, product, version, … related metasploit modules.  It links to tweets about this vulnerability! searches twitter for it I think… similarly for youtube and google. can generate a customized rss feed.

name: Secunia Database
description: Database of security advisories updated daily, given an id number, release date, comments, a popularity score, criticality level, etc... Also has CVE references.

name: Vulnerability Notes Database
description: High level (coarser) vulnerability database.  For example, many CVE entries are rolled into one entry here

name: NVD CVE Updates
description: This feed provides information on all recent CVE vulnerabilities. The advantage is that you learn about new CVE vulnerabilities as soon as possible.

name: NVD CVE Analyzed Updates
description: This feed provides only fully analyzed CVE vulnerabilities. The advantage is that we are able to provide vulnerable product names in the title.

name: NVD Official Vendor Statements on CVE Vulnerabilities
description: NVD provides a service whereby software development organizations can submit Official Vendor Statements on the set of CVE vulnerabilities that apply to their products.

name: Risk Database
description: RiskDB is a free, centralized, and open repository of security vulnerabilities sourced from vulnerability databases. It provides up-to-the-minute information on security-related software flaws, misconfigurations, vulnerabilities, and threat advisories. This data can be used for vulnerability remediation and compliance.

name: Security Tracker
description: an entry has CVE links, versions affected, descriptions, impact, solution, vendor URL, cause, and OS's affected

name: SecurityFocus
description: Bugtraq vulnerability list from Symantec.  Associated email archives: http://www.securityfocus.com/archive/1

name: US-CERT National Cyber Awareness System Alerts
description: Alerts warn about vulnerabilities, incidents, and other security issues that pose a significant risk.

name: US-CERT National Cyber Awareness System Bulletins
description: Bulletins provide weekly summaries of new vulnerabilities. Patch information is provided when available.

name: US-CERT National Cyber Awareness System Current Activity
description: Current Activity provides timely information on security risks to help you better protect your systems from malware campaigns and mitigate against new software vulnerabilities.

name: Symantec List of Advisories
description: list of vulnerabilities

name: Xforce
description: IT services from IBM

name: Sohphos Virus Alerts
description: The lates virus alerts published by Sophos.

name: Sophos Latest suspicious behavior and file alerts
description: Files that are already executing and behaving questionably are detected as suspicious behavior, while files that look untrustworthy before they execute are detected as suspicious files.

name: F-Secure Virus and threat descriptions
description: Find descriptions and removal advice for malware, spyware and riskware threats detected by Labs.

name: Offensive Computing
description: Offensive Computing was formed as a resource for the computer security community by Danny Quist. The primary emphasis here is on malware collections and analysis for the purpose of improving people's abilities to defend their networks. We provide resources such as live copies of malicious software, md5sums to search on and analysis of the malware to the general public. Will be transitioning to a download-only malware repository in the coming weeks. The blog site will be officially shutting down.

name: Sophos Potentially Unwanted Application (PUA) Alerts
description: A list of known and potentially unwanted applications published by Sophos.

name: Sophos Controlled Application List
description: Lists of benign but potentially vulnerable applications published by Sophos.

name: Spamhaus IP-based DNS-based Blackhole Lists (DNSBLs)
description: ZEN is the combination of all Spamhaus IP-based DNSBLs into one single powerful and comprehensive blocklist to make querying faster and simpler. It contains the SBL, SBLCSS, XBL and PBL blocklists.

name: Malware Domain List
description: table of malware-related domains.  (rss available, but does not include 'reverse' field)

name: Malware Domains
description: tab separated list of domains that are related to malware

name: Malware Domains - additional lists
description: additional lists of domains that are related to malware

name: ZeuS domain blocklist
description: list of domains that are related to malware

name: Malware Patrol
description: list of domains that are related to malware

name: SpyEye Tracker
description: Tracks and monitors SpyEye C&Cs

name: Exposure Blacklist
description: list of domains related to malware

name: Sourcefire Vulnerability Research Team Labs
description: list of domains related to malware

name: Clean MX realtime database
description: list of domains related to malware

name: Malware Blacklist
description: list of malware domains, generated from honeypot data.  Includes URL, registrar, IP, ASN, and hosting

name: URL blacklist dot com
description: downloadable Blacklist

name: ISC suspicious domains
description: There are many suspicious domains on the internet. In an effort to identify them, as well as false positives, we have assembled weighted lists based on tracking and malware lists from different sources. ISC is collecting and categorizing various lists associated with a certain level of sensitivity.

name: MaxMind
description: IP GeoLocation

name: Common Platform Enumeration
description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) is a dictionary of common IT systems, platforms, and packages encoded in a standardized naming format that is suitable for machine interpretation and processing.

name: virus total
description: VirusTotal, a subsidiary of Google, is a free online service that analyzes files and URLs enabling the identification of viruses, worms, trojans and other kinds of malicious content detected by antivirus engines and website scanners. At the same time, it may be used as a means to detect false positives, i.e. innocuous resources detected as malicious by one or more scanners.

name: malwr
description: an online service that analyzes malware samples

name: VX Vault
description: Includes MD5s, domains, IPs, file information, and links to their samples (account needed)

name: malc0de
description: automated malware analysis system, associates malware samples with domains and related info

name: Threat Expert
description: advanced automated threat analysis system designed to analyze and report the behavior of computer viruses, worms, trojans, adware, spyware, and other security-related risks in a fully automated mode. In only a few minutes ThreatExpert can process a sample and generate a highly detailed threat report with the level of technical detail that matches or exceeds antivirus industry standards such as those normally found in online virus encyclopedias.

name: URL Query
description: 'urlQuery.net is a service for detecting and analyzing web-based malware. It provides detailed information about the activities a browser does while visiting a site and presents the information for further analysis.'  Includes reports on many benign domains.   'The API is currently in closed beta testing.'

name: Common Configuration Enumeration
description: CCE provides unique identifiers to system configuration issues in order to facilitate fast and accurate correlation of configuration data across multiple information sources and tools.

name: First Common Vulnerability Scoring System
description: CVSS is a vulnerability scoring system designed to provide an open and standardized method for rating IT vulnerabilities.

name: dataloss database
description: Every day, project curators and volunteers scour news feeds, blogs, and other websites looking for data breaches, new and old. We search for incidents that need to be updated, or incidents that are not yet in the database. We then add them to the database, mail out members of the mailing list, and Tweet the breach out to Twitter.

name: Honeynet
description: To learn the tools, tactics and motives involved in computer and network attacks, and share the lessons learned.

name: The Emerging Threats Open Source Community
description: 200,000 active users sharing free IDS rulesets on a daily basis.  It’s a fast-moving, frequently updated group, with users who are experts in detecting and preventing malware attacks on Snort, Suricata, BSD operating systems, and many other IDS and IPS platforms.

name: OpenIOC - Indicators of Compromise
description: Windows-only framework and tools for XML-based rules for locating files, registry entries, etc.

name: DNSDB
description: DNS database, stores indexes passive and authoritative DNS data.  Can search for RRsets and metadata.

name: Deutsche Telekom Cyber Initiatives
description: Current Threatscape info and statistics

name: Information Assurance Support Environment (IASE)
description: .xls or .xlm file giving CVE announcments for DoD configuration standards

name: Web Application Security Consortium - Web Hacking Incident Database (WHID)
description: project dedicated to maintaining a list of web applications related security incidents. WHID's goal is to serve as a tool for raising awareness of the web application security problem and provide information for statistical analysis of web applications security incidents.

name: Netcraft
description: phishing database and feed, 'internet data mining', commercial service (only?).

name: Microsoft Comprehensive Security Alerts
description: Provides comprehensive security alerts and bulletins for IT professionals.  The free Comprehensive alerts serve as an incremental supplement to the Basic Alerts. It provides advance notification of upcoming security bulletins, security advisories, and timely notification of any minor changes to previously released Microsoft Security Bulletins or Advisories.

name: Microsoft Security Response Center
description: Microsoft Security Response Center: The official corporate security response blog

name: Microsoft Security Advisories
description: Microsoft Security Advisories, a supplement to the Microsoft Security Bulletins, address security changes that may not require a security bulletin but that may still affect customers' overall security.

name: Oracle Alerts
description: Anouncements for patches and security fixes to Oracle Products

name: Apple Security Anouncements
description: Anouncements for patches, updates and security news for Apple products.

name: Symantec Security Response
description: Our security research centers around the world provide unparalleled analysis of and protection from malware, security risks, vulnerabilities, and spam.

name: SANS Internet Storm Center
description: SANS Internet Storm Center - Latest Diaries.

name: Sophos Naked Security
description: Naked Security is Sophos's award-winning threat news room, giving you news, opinion, advice and research on computer security issues and the latest internet threats.

name: Krebs on Security
description: In-depth security news and investigation from Brian Krebs.  Coverage of specific breaches and incidents, as well as malware and vulnerabilities.

name: F-Secure News from the Lab
description: Weblog of F-Secure Antivirus Research Team.  Covers various topics, including malware and vulnerabilities.

name: Team Cymru Research
description: Team Cymru Research NFP is a specialized Internet security research firm and 501(c)3 non-profit dedicated to making the Internet more secure. Team Cymru helps organizations identify and eradicate problems in their networks, providing insight that improves lives.
comments: This RSS feed includes article links in a non-standard way.

name: Spamhaus News
description: The Spamhaus Project is an international nonprofit organization whose mission is to track the Internet's spam operations and sources, to provide dependable realtime anti-spam protection for Internet networks, to work with Law Enforcement Agencies to identify and pursue spam gangs worldwide, and to lobby governments for effective anti-spam legislation.

name: Wired: Threat Level
description: Wired magazine's online security blog focusing on privacy, crime and online security.

name: Schneier on Security
description: Security expert Bruce Schneier blogs about both technical and societal security.

name: McAfee Blog
description: Blogs from McAfee about topics ranging from security research to comprimised applications.

name: Kaspersky Secure List
description: News about the current and emerging THREATSCAPE and updates about Kaspersky products.

name: Computer World Security Blog
description: Blog by ComputerWorld to keep the public up to date on current security news and risks.

name: Stack Exchange Security Blog
description: Community driven IT and security blog from StackExchange.

name: Ars Technica: Risk Assesment
description: Ars Technica's security blog that focuses on topics useful to a semi technical person.

name: CNet Security
description: Feed from CNet of security news suitable for general consumption.

name: RSA: Speaking of Security
description: General security blog from RSA.

name: Forbes: Firewall
description: Blog from Forbes magazine about security topics with a focus on business.

name: Jeremiah Grossman Blog
description: Jeremiah Grossman is a respected internet, security and privacy blogger.

name: security.stackexchange.com
description: An online message board for general computer security.

name: Tao Security Blog
description: good articles, mostly general / high level stuff, not specific alerts or etc.

name: slashdot
description: news for nerds

name: Security Week
description: news

name: Computer World
description: news

name: Security Street
description: Recent content in Rapid7 Community.  Contains some news on metasploit and other products, some news on new vulnerabilities, some malware news, etc.

name: Threat Post
description: The Kaspersky Lab Security News Service.  Contains many articles on malware and vulnerabilities.

name: Malware Bytes
description: A security blog about malware and computer security news.

name: Securelist Malware Descriptions
description: malware descriptions

name: The Hacker News
description: news of malware, attacks, hackers, etc..

name: Trend Micro
description: Exploits, Vulnerabilities, Spam, Malware info

name: Securelist
description: Threatscape info, popular malware exploits

name: Darknet
description: Blog updates from Darknet about recent hacks and information about ethical cracking and penetration testing.

name: AUS-CERT
description: leading Computer Emergency Response Team for Australia and provides computer information security advice to the Australian public

name: Xforce Security Intelligence
description: Analysis and Insight for Information Security Professionals.

name: Dark Reading
description: Dark Reading is the premier online resource helping information security professionals manage the balance between protection and access. It offers breaking news and analysis on attacks, breaches and vulnerabilities, as well as strategies for protecting enterprise data. It also offers guidance on setting risk management and compliance policies.

name: Windows Security
description: Network Security Articles for Windows Server 2003, 2008 & Vista

name: CIF v2 rules
description: Black/white/grey lists that feed into CIF

name: CIF v1 rules
description: Black/white/grey lists that feed into CIF

name: CIF potential new sources
description: Black/white/grey lists that feed into CIF - list of potential new sources, not yet added

name: Packetstorm Exploit List
description: Collection of exploits and related info

name: Packetstorm News
description: Packet Storm - Information Security Services, News, Files, Tools, Exploits, Advisories and Whitepapers

name: malwageddon
description: 'Malware Analysis: The Final Frontier' - Malware analysis blog

name: the golden messenger
description: 'Analyzing Unknown Malware' - Malware analysis blog

name: Malicious IP Search
description: Google custom search, also includes links to several tools and blacklists

name: zeltser - Malware Sample Sources for Researchers
description: collection of links to malware samples collections

name: zeltser - Malicious IP lists
description: collection of malicious IP lists from various sources

name: Contagio - links and resources
description: large list of links to other malware samples repositories.  (some are outdated)

name: Contagio
description: malware analysis blog, includes many samples, pcaps, and other info.  Includes much information about exploit packs.

name: Malwarebytes forum - Newest Malware Threats
description: Newest malware samples, submitted by forum users.

name: xorl %eax, %eax
description: Blog with detailed analysis of many vulnerabilities

name: Kaspersky security matters blog
description: Eugene Kaspersky security blog

name: scans.io Internet-Wide Scan Data Repository
description: Datasets from various internet-wide scans.

name: Internet Census 2012
description: Several massive datasets from the 2012 'Internet Census'

name: Farsight Security DNS Database (DNSDB)
description: DNS database and related resources/programs/APIs
